name: Hilton Marco Island Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights in late June 2009. This is a beautiful hotel on the beach. We got a good deal on Orbitz (probably because this time of year is low season for Marco Island). We had a spacious room with a king size bed on the 10th floor, so the view of the beach and the island was wonderful, and we enjoyed watching sunsets over the water from our balcony. The room had a frig which was great for keeping the bottled water we bought at the grocery store cold. Our room also had 2 sinks- 1 sink next to the bathroom and 1 sink behind the bathroom door (along with the toilet and tub/shower). Having 2 sinks is very handy when more than one person needs to get ready at the same time. Another thing we really liked about the hotel was the shopping center across the street which has several restaurants; it was so nice to be able to walk to dinner, enjoy a drink or two, and walk back to the hotel. The shopping center also had an ice cream shop, which we visited and a movie theater, which we didn't visit. We will definitely stay at the Hilton again when planning future trips to Marco Island.
reviews.title: Fun on the beach

reviews.text: Really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton. The rooms were perfect, very nice and clean.
reviews.title: Great time with the family

reviews.text: The pool and beach area great. Never too crowded.
reviews.title: Perfect vacation

reviews.text: The whole family had a great time.
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton will return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The moment we pulled up to the front door the staff was helpful, professional, and catered to all our needs. You truly get what you pay for!
reviews.title: Great Place, Great View, Great Time

reviews.text: My husband and I had our wedding at the Hilton Marco Island in May. The Hilton did an amazing job!
reviews.title: An amazing wedding weekend!

reviews.text: Pool – Good service at the pool. Staff pays attention to the little umbrellas when you want service. At this time of year there were plenty of chairs available.
reviews.title: Should stay longer
Small more Initimate Resort
reviews.text: Beach – beautiful expansive beaches! Yes you have to rent an umbrella, but for a day or two this is not bad. As others recommend – go buy one across the street if you wish to save some money. The shells on the beach are a little rough on your feet if you plan to do a lot of walking. Beach shoes are helpful.
Food – you are at a resort – yes the food is a little pricey. The concierge can recommend local restaurants if you have a car and wish to find other options.
reviews.title: I love Marco Island

reviews.text: Nightlife/Shopping – There are not a lot of bars and shopping in Marco Island. Some shopping is available, so if you need something you can surely find it somewhere. Come here for the beach and the resort – not the nightlife.
reviews.title: Nice resort, too bad about some of the guests

reviews.text: We love this resort.
reviews.title: Perfect stay
CHECK THE MARRIOT OUT
reviews.text: We have been coming to Marco Island and staying at the Hilton since 1984. The hotel has been updated quite a few times, and it's great in every way.
The only negative would have to be that they started charging for parking a few years ago.
reviews.title: We Love this Hotel!

reviews.text: We have been going to Hilton Marco for over twenty years. Always had a great time, until the last three or four years. I give up, we have jumped ship and gone to the Marriot. I took a group of 6 (my family) to their restaurant ...restaurant was empty....they forgot one order and it took them over an hour to serve us. we complained to management and they slipped a discount coupon for the jet boats under our door. This hotel use to be great for business men and their families, but now that the hotel has lowered their rates it has become a nightmare. We had to leave the pool a number of times over the last few years because of rowdy guests. This use to be a great hotel....We hate to leave ....many memories.....but, Thanks Hilton...cest la vie! Were coming back to Marco next month...staying at Marriot
reviews.title: I Can't Wait to Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I have stayed at this hotel twice now and we love it. The over 14 hour journey to there from the UK is more than worth it!
reviews.title: Wonderful Week at the Hilton

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Marco Island for a week, and it was a great experience. The rooms were excellent and well furnished. We had two regular rooms with Gulf view and balconies and one suite with an exceptional view right on the beach. The bathrooms were somewhat small, but with high quality fixtures. Rooms were very quiet with little noise from the hallways or adjacent rooms.
reviews.title: A wonderful resort in Marco Island

reviews.text: The hotel is not huge, which we liked. Even during a holiday week there were always more than enough lounges around the pool or at the beach. The pool and hot-tub were quite nice and never too crowded. A nice feature was the poolside bar and cafe. There was also waiter service for food and drinks around the pool. The beach is huge with wonderful white sand. You can walk for miles in both directions on the beach. In addition to the beach cafe, there are two nice restaurants - one casual and the other more elegant. Both have very good food, with Sandcastles, the more elegant restaurant having really excellent food.
reviews.title: Really nice Hilton on the beach
Can't wait to go back!
reviews.text: Service is first rate. All the staff are very attentive and helpful. Highly recommended.

We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights in late December in a 1 King bedroom suite with 1.5 bathrooms facing the Gulf (south view) on the fifth floor. The rooms were large and clean. The bathroom off the bedroom lacks shelves for personal items. Shower had hot water at all times of the day. The maid service was excellent, with the room cleaned between the time we left for breakfast and the time we returned after breakfast. The hotel has a small gift shop with the essentials and a nice staff, though I wish it stocked alcohol so I could grab a beer or get some wine. Self-parking was $10 + tax a day and easy. The concierge, Tina, was excellent with her knowledge of the area attractions and dry English humor.
reviews.title: Vacation at Marco Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was good, though they could rotate or add some new items as everything was the same for our duration. As HHonors Gold, we were able to upgrade to the full buffet for $6 with the breakfast coupons. Ashley, the restaurant manager, was there every morning and working hard (kudos to her). I would skip the Seafood Buffet on Friday night as I don’t think it was worth the money. The seafood was good and fresh, but not enough variety and there were no Stone Crabs (even though I asked before and was told there would be). There are some great restaurants directly across the street from the Hilton.
reviews.title: Not worth money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a Gulf View junior suite which the description stated had spectacular views of the Gulf . Our room was on the south side and had excellent views of the hotel adjacent and a very limted view of the Gulf . If booking try for the north side and you will have excellent views which the manager admitted , but stated was twice the cost
reviews.title: Poor View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hilton from June 17th - June 20th. We had a great rate of $145 per night and that included the full breakfast buffet for both of us each day ($20 per person normally). We had a very nice room on the 10th floor very close to the beach end of the hotel. Although we had a very pretty view, if we had been on the opposite side of the hall we would have had a better view up the beach and over the pool. Hey, it was still a great view, so no use complaining. Nicely appointed room with quality fixtures and an extra vanity outside of the bathroom. The room had lots of drawers and storage areas. It also had a couch, 2 chairs, one ottoman and a desk and chair. There was also a small fridge and a flat panel TV. The A/C kept things cool although it seemed to stop one night and we had to reset it. The linens, bed, and pillows were fantastic. There was an ice machine and a pop machine at the end of the hall. Pop was only $1.50 for a 20oz bottle.
reviews.title: Nice Stay - Great Value

reviews.text: I was hoping to stay at the Marriott but it was $150 more per night and it didn't include breakfast. The Hilton was too good a deal to pass up and we were really pleased with what we received.
reviews.title: Excellent Place to Stay in Marco Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby bar was nice, we had a smoked turkey quesadilla before sunset one evening and it was tasty. The burger was ok at the pool bar after our wave runner tour and my girlfriend’s chicken tenders were decent. The breakfasts though were very good. The list price of the buffet ($20) might sound a little steep, but you get fresh OJ, Coffee, made to order omelets and waffles, plus great fresh fruit, Danish, sausage, bacon, potatoes, and lots of other things. They have a really nice screened in porch type area that you can eat outside as well. Since it was included in our rate it made it all the better!
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised - Nice Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We then did the Jet Ski tour of the islands from the people at the Hilton. They did a very nice job. It was $135 for each of us (after a $10 rate reduction for being guests of the Hilton) and we each took our own wave runner. We had a great time. I got a good bit of sun on my shoulders, but we saw some wildlife and got to zip around the gulf and troll through the mangroves. The guide was very nice.
reviews.title: Great Stay

aka: Hilton Marco Island Beach Hotel Marco Island

This AAA 4- Diamond deluxe 11-story Florida beach resort is only minutes from world-class golfing, the Florida Everglades National Park and some of Southwest Florida's best shopping, dining and recreational activities. Marco Island is conveniently located near Naples, Florida.At the Hilton Marco Island, Florida Resort and hotel, we feature 297 guest rooms including 22 gulf-view one-bedroom suites, and four luxuriously appointed two-bedroom penthouses.The Marco Island Spa at our resort hotel is the perfect hideaway in Southwest Florida. The Spa is a luxuriously appointed full service spa featuring signature facials, therapeutic massages, restoring body treatments, nail care, hair care and relaxation lounges. Our Marco Island spa also features a retail boutique as well as a state-of-the art fitness complex.The Hilton Marco Island, Florida hotel offers Activities and sightseeing opportunities for the entire familyThe Hilton Marco Island, FL hotel and resort offers guests an array of choices for both casual and elegant dining.Planning an Event or Meeting? With 12,000 square feet of total meeting and event facilities, superb catering, wonderful accommodations in a stunning location the Hilton hotel in Marco Island is everything you'll need for a flawless event.So whether for a family vacation, a weekend getaway or to attend a conference, make the Hilton Marco Island Beach Resort and Spa your choice in Southwest Florida.
